critique: This executive order pertains to employment conditions within the Panama Canal service during World War II. It authorizes the Governor of The Panama Canal to provide free transportation and subsistence allowances to individuals engaged for service in the Isthmus of Panama. Given the context of wartime, the order aims to facilitate the recruitment and deployment of personnel to support the war effort in a strategically important location. There is no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy, or civil liberties concerns. The order expands executive power to manage the Panama Canal effectively during wartime. It also centralizes authority in the federal government to manage the canal. There is a slight intervention in the economy by providing benefits to employees. There is no indication of social inclusion or exclusion.
